name: Ritsumeikan APU - University app UI design
description:
𝐇𝐞𝐫𝐞'𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐦: I STRESS over Ritsumeikan Asia Pacific University’s Campus Terminal (our campus-wide news portal). More than 6,000 students, faculty and staff have to use it every day, yet the platform ... is not optimal.


So I thought ... why not give it a make-over? Let's make it to something we actually are willing to use and have a productive time using it.


ーーーーー

This was my first UI Redesign project. I pitched it to my classmates (the end-users) for feedback, such as reworking the information hierarchy (making fields with higher importance more visible, the white background color can be softer, and more negative space). All comments were very constructive, which made me reflect on the reasoning behind my decisions. You truly can't do UI without UX, and vice versa. They're meant to be together ;)
